snippet: The Newtown tragedy may provide the National Rifle Association with its first genuine test in years.
abstract: National Rifle Association has remained silent after the second-deadliest school shooting in United States history in Newtown, Conn, but it still wields one of the biggest sticks in politics, with a $300 million budget, millions of members around the country and virtually unmatched ferocity in advancing its political and legislative interests; some opponents speculate that Newtown shooting may provide the NRA with first genuine test of its political power in over a decade.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE, MICHAEL COOPER and MICHAEL LUO

lead_paragraph: The Newtown tragedy may provide the National Rifle Association with its first genuine test in years.

headline.seo: Silent Since Shootings, N.R.A. Could Face Challenge to Political Power
headline.main: Silent Since Shootings, N.R.A. Could Face Challenge to Political Power
headline.print_headline: Silent Since Shootings, N.R.A. Could Face Challenge to Political Power
